original_title: Sri Lanka hikes import taxes on wheat flour to boost rice farmer profits
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka has ended concessionary taxes on wheat flour to give higher profits to domestic rice farmers, State Minister for Finance Ranjith Siyambalapitiya said.

With the ending of 3 rupees per kilo tax, levies will go back to a 15 percent import duty and other taxes like the port and airport levy which will add about 45 rupees per kilo to import costs, importers said.
As a close substitute for rice, the price of wheat has to be ‘managed’ Minister Siyambalapitiya said.
Sri Lanka’s rice farmers have been protected with import taxes by politicians and domestic rice cannot be exported unlike in East Asian countries like Thailand and Vietnam.
The tax hike of wheat to boost rice farmer profits comes amid reported malnutrition and families missing meals. (Colombo/May08/2023)
